data.title: London Coliseum
data.meta_description: The only website selling tickets for the Studio Ghibli's Oscar-winning film, re-imagined for the London stage until 24 August 2024.
data.text:
Studio Ghibli’s Oscar-winning Spirited Away, created by legendary animator and director Hayao Miyazaki is re-imagined for the stage by Olivier and Tony award-winning director of Les Misérables, John Caird.

The original Japanese cast* perform this extraordinary production with wildly imaginative puppets, dazzling set and costume designs and a live orchestra playing the magnificent original film score by Joe Hisaishi.

View cast

A masterpiece of storytelling and stunning visuals Spirited Away tells the enchanting tale of Chihiro who while traveling to a new home with her family, stumbles into a world of fantastic spirits ruled over by the sorceress Yubaba.

When her parents are turned into pigs and she is put to work in a magical bathhouse, Chihiro must use her wits to survive in this strange new place, find a way to free her parents, and return to the normal world.

Audiences in the UK now have the chance to be spirited away and delight in the mystery of this genre-defining animation classic at the West End’s iconic London Coliseum for a strictly limited season.

*This show is in Japanese with English translation visible from all seats. The English translation appears in yellow writing on three black screens in the auditorium.

Age guidance: 7+. Note: Children under five are not allowed in the auditorium.

Please note that the Producers cannot guarantee the appearance of a particular cast member. No refunds or exchanges will be offered as a result of a cast member’s unavailability to perform at any performance.

Tickets available from £28 including booking fee*

Please be aware London Coliseum is the only site selling tickets for Spirited Away.

We take a very strong view on secondary reselling and if we believe a ticket has been resold we may refuse entry to the ticket holder. To ensure you have a great visit to our theatre we ask that you do not risk purchasing a fake ticket through other sites.

Accessible Performances

Audio described

Thursday 23 May 2024 evening

Relaxed Environment

Wednesday 12 June matinee

(please email us for accessible seating at [email protected])
